Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 90th overall pick, by Philadelphia in 1965...
Injured on 7/21/1966 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Injured on 4/16/1967 with a Bruised Jaw, out for one week...
Injured on 7/20/1969 with a Fractured Hand, out for 4 weeks...
Had first career hit on 6/9/1970, off Nelson Briles (PIT)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/22/1970, off Dick Hughes (STL)...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Pittsburgh on 7/12/1971...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1973...
Injured on 5/28/1975 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Baltimore on 2/18/1976 to a 3-year deal worth $980,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1976, hitting .588 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
